snippet: Clinton strategists see a one-of-a-kind resource: a popular, sitting president who can be deployed to battleground states to drum up support.
abstract: Pres Barack Obama will go out on his own to rally for Hillary Rodham Clinton, effort that Clinton's advisers believe will help her in every swing states in general election; Obama is arguably more popular now than in 2008 and 2012 in Colorado, Florida, Michigan and Ohio, all states that are critical to Clinton’s electoral strategy.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and PATRICK HEALY

lead_paragraph: Clinton strategists see a one-of-a-kind resource: a popular, sitting president who can be deployed to battleground states to drum up support.

headline.main: Where to, Hillary? How Clinton Is Relying on President Obama’s Help
headline.print_headline: Clinton to Seek President’s Help in States He Won
